content:
Art. 4.187. 
Wills 
made in a place which is inaccessible due to a contagious disease 
Wills made in a place with which all communication is intercepted due to a contagious disease may be made before the justice of the peace, or before one of the registrars of the commune, in the presence of two witnesses.
This provision applies both to those who are affected by these diseases and to those who are in places where they are infected, even if they are not currently ill.
These wills become null and void six months after communications have been re-established in the place where the testator is, or six months after he has passed to a place where they have not been interrupted.
